content.description: Head up ramp to start of crack. Fingers and hands to off- width roof. The crux is pulling the roof. The right wall is still a little grungy at the base.
content.protection: .5 - 4 camalots. An anchor can be built at the top or the pinnacle can be slung with ~10 feet of cord.
content.location: The route is north facing. Hike up to the base of the dome and traverse uphill around the backside. You can tunnel through the boulders to get to the base. There are 2 bolts with slings on the south face that can be rapped to the ground with at 70m rope.

content.description: Easy, low angle crack for first pitch. There’s 3 cracks to choose from a 5.6 to the left, a 5.7 in the middle and a 5.6 to the right. It’s fun to practice placing gear in cracks in a safe and easy way!
content.location: Note that the Cochise Guidebook approach is incorrect. Do not wrap around the backside of the dome to access this route. Go directly up the wash to the right of the dome, take a left, and handrail the dome to the start.

content.description: Accidental FA. We were looking for Butt Hurt (5.12+) and saw the obvious hand crack just to the left of Butt Hurt. Assuming that was the route and the crux was the roof, we just went for it. Turns out, it's not Butt Hurt, but it is a neat little hand crack with some cool roof moves. Bring your fists!Shares a finish with Butt Hurt. Beware of extreme rope drag (we got our rope stuck the first time) through the roof. Build an anchor in the crack above the roof. Rap the Bubble Butt Dome Rap Anchors. If you're going to spend the effort to hike around to Butt Hurt, might as well get in as many pitches as possible!
content.protection: Single .3-.5, #5 doubles to #4. Some may want an extra 3 or 4 if not comfy at the grade. Belay either just over the roof to avoid impossible rope drag or creatively keep the rope out of the crack and hope for the best.
content.location: Do the Bubble Butt Dome approach, hiking through the wash and up the cow trails to the right of the formation. Once you reach Bubble Butt Dome hike left around the backside of the formation and squeeze under a massive boulder. We left a few cairns. Carefully rock hop across the boulders and to the start of Butt Hurt and Ass Pain!

content.description: There are 3 low angle cracks on the southwest face.
